name: Disability / Accessibility Issues
description: The Mayor's Office on Disability accepts grievances from community members on various disability and access related issues, including American Disability Act compliance (ADA compliance), service animals and curb / sidewalk access.
fullDescription: The Mayor's Office on Disability accepts grievances from community members on various disability and access related issues, including American Disability Act compliance (ADA compliance), service animals and curb / sidewalk access.
whatTheyOffer: The Mayor's Office on Disability accepts grievances from community members on various disability and access related issues, including American Disability Act compliance (ADA compliance), service animals and curb / sidewalk access.
howToGetIt: Appointments and walk-ins are welcome at 1455 Market Street, Floor 13B, Tuesday through Thursday, 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. For walk-ins: Our new building security guidelines require walk-in visitors to register at the front desk and show proof of identification. To schedule an appointment: Call (415) 554-0670 or email ODA@sfgov.org. Request reasonable accommodations: We strive to provide reasonable accommodations as soon as possible. For accommodations that require advance preparation – such as American Sign Language (ASL) interpretation or materials in Braille – please submit your request at least 72 hours before your visit.
